Key Match Events: The Dallas Mavericks broke their five-game losing streak with a big win over the Los Angeles Lakers, 118-97.
Despite a near triple-double from LeBron James, the Mavericks mostly held Anthony Davis in check, limiting him to 21 points on 7/18 shooting.
Quentin Grimes delivered one of his best performances with 23 points, nine rebounds, and six assists on 6/11 shooting from three-point range.
The Mavericks held the Lakers to 45.3% from the floor and 31.4% from three-point range.
The Mavericks limited LeBron James, Anthony Davis, and Austin Reaves to a combined 18/44 shooting.
Pre-Game Insights: Spencer Dinwiddie mentioned in a mid-game interview that their goal was to hold the Lakers below 100 points.
